Hi guys,
  I already wrote a solution,
  that is not entirely satisfactory,
  but it does the work.
  I made the subclasses of the base TestCase
  to pass ArrayList of method names(Strings) 
  that are executed using Reflection API in 
  the BaseTest run method.
 
  If anyone is interested in the code I wrote
  he/she can reach me at hedgi@....


> I'm coming a little late to the thread, but... why
> can't you just put
> them all in the same test method?  Break them up if
> you like:
> 
> public void testALotOfStuff() {
>     checkA();
>     checkB();
>     checkC();
> }
> 
> If any of the checkX() methods fails, the others
> aren't run, but the
> test is cleaned up.
> 
> -Kevin
Hi Kevin, 
I can't do this, because there are too many different
combinations of checkX() methods that could be tested
in the subclass, so I will write some redundant
methods
that will not be used. Besides subclass might not want
to execute checkX(). But the JUnit executes all 
testXXX(). What's more my checkX() are designed as
separate tests and I do think "setUp" and "tearDown"
have to be executed between them.

I still do not regard my solution as perfect.
But it does the job - the statistics of
Error/Failure/Number of tests works fine and I'm able
to quickly locate where an error has happened.

Thanks a lot to all,
  Kaloyan
